snippet: In requiring the police to prove a beverage was alcoholic, Judge Noach Dear wrote that drinking summonses were being issued in a racially biased manner.
abstract: Brooklyn Criminal Court Judge Noach Dear dismisses case against Julio Figueroa, cited for illegally drinking beer outside his home after a police officer smelled the contents of his cup; Dear signals intent to hold New York City police to a highly impractical standard of proving beverages contain alcohol in order to issue a summons for drinking in public, a violation he says singles out blacks and Latinos.
lead_paragraph: In requiring the police to prove a beverage was alcoholic, Judge Noach Dear wrote that drinking summonses were being issued in a racially biased manner.

headline.seo: Sniff Test Doesn’t Prove Public Drinking, Judge Says
headline.main: Sniff Test Does Not Prove Public Drinking, a Judge Rules
headline.print_headline: An Officer’s Sniff Test Does Not Prove Public Drinking, a Brooklyn Judge Rules
